document.docTitle: Pseudocanthon vazdemelloi Nazare-Silva & Silva 2021, new species
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the South American species of Pseudocanthon Bates, 1887 (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Scarabaeinae: Deltochilini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the South American species of Pseudocanthon Bates, 1887 (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Scarabaeinae: Deltochilini)

heading.emphasis:
Pseudocanthon vazdemelloi Nazaré-Silva & Silva
, new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology . The species is named after the Brazilian scarabaeidologist Fernando Zagury Vaz-de-Mello as recognition for so many years of fruitful collaboration with the second author, and for his valuable contributions towards the taxonomy of dung beetles.

Diagnosis .
Pseudocanthon vazdemelloi
is similar to
P . pantanensis
and
P . chaquensis
in having the pronotum with dense, well-impressed granulate microsculpture centrally ( Fig. 2A ). However,
P . vazdemelloi
can be easily distinguished by the eighth elytral stria absent or reduced to basal one-fourth of the elytra ( Fig. 2C ); posterior edge of metafemur regularly curved, not projected towards the abdominal ventrites ( Fig. 4C ); apex of parameres curved inward, forming an acute spiniform projection at ventral edge ( Fig. 5D ); frontolateral peripheral (FLP) endophallite elongate, bifurcate at inferior portion ( Fig. 6D ); and accessory endophallite (AE) small and elongate ( Fig. 6D ). In
P . pantanensis
and
P . chaquensis
, in turn, the eighth stria extends to across the basal half of the elytra ( Fig. 2D ); and the posterior edge of metafemur is lightly angulate at basal third and expanded towards the abdominal ventrites ( Fig. 4D–E ). In
P . pantanensis
, in particular, the parameres are curved and pointed apically ( Fig. 5E ), the frontolateral peripheral endophallite is sinuous, with inferior portion rounded ( Fig. 6E ) and the AE absent ( Fig. 6E ), whereas in
P . chaquensis
the parameres are truncate apically ( Fig. 5F ). We did not find any significant differences in the shape of frontolateral peripheral endophallite and accessory endophallite between
P . vazdemelloi
and
P . chaquensis
. Both species have frontolateral peripheral endophallite elongate, bifurcate at inferior portion, and AE small, elongate ( Figs. 6D, F ).

Description .
Holotype . Length
. 5.0 mm. Width . 3.3 mm . Colour . Surface of body dark brown with metallic green reflections; legs orange; orange spot on clypeus and on last abdominal ventrite. Surface punctation and sculpturing . In general, surface punctation consists of foveolate punctures. Surface of head, mesoventrite, metaventrite, elytra, abdomen, tibiae, and femora with dense and well-impressed granulate microsculpture; lateral edges and anterior angle of pronotum, hypomera, lateral edges, and anterior portion of metaventrite, mesepimeron, metanepisternum, epipleuron, tibiae, and femora with imbricate microsculpture. Pronotum with dense and wellimpressed granulate microsculpture centrally ( Fig. 2A ). Elytra . Eighth elytral stria absent or reduced to basal one-fourth of the elytra ( Fig. 2C ). Legs . Posterior edge of metafemur regularly curved, not projected towards the abdominal ventrites ( Fig. 4C ). Tegmen . Apex of parameres curved inward, forming an acute spiniform projection at ventral edge ( Fig. 5D ). Endophallus . Frontolateral peripheral (FLP) endophallite elongate, bifurcate at inferior portion ( Fig. 6D ); acessory endophallite (AE) small and elongate ( Fig. 6D ).

Type material.
6♀ and 6♂ .
Holotype . BRAZIL :
MATO GROSSO : Poconé , Pousada Araras , [ 16°30’43.39’’S ; 56°42’41.61’’W ],
03.XII.1998
, J. Moreno & T. Mestre—
1♂ ( CEMT ).
Paratypes . BRAZIL :
MATO GROSSO : Poconé , Pousada Araras , [ 16°30’43.39’’S ; 56°42’41.61’’W ],
03.XII.1998
, J. Moreno & T. Mestre—
4♀ 3♂ ( CEMT ).
ARGENTINA :
FORMOSA: Parque Nacional Pilcomayo , [ 25°08’43.11’’S ; 58°11’11.78’’W ],
76 m
,
17.XII.1990
,

J. Peck — 1♂ ( CMNC )
;
SANTA FÉ : Rosário , [ 32°57’31.33’’S ; 60°41’34.95’’W ],
32 m
,
I.1939
, no collector— 1♀ 1♂ ( CMNC )
;
CORRIENTES : [ 27°28’09.17’’S ; 58°49’50.29’’W ],
63 m
,
III.1976
, Martínez — 1♀ ( CMNC )
.

Distribution . Known from Argentina ( Corrientes , Formosa , and Santa Fé ) and Brazil ( Mato Grosso ) ( Fig. 7B ). Areas of endemism [South America]: Brazilian subregion : South Brazilian dominion: Rondônia province . Chacoan subregion : Chacoan dominion: Chaco province (see Morrone 2014 : fig. 12).
